containers.description: Enhance your Workers with serverless containers.
containers.upgrade.title: Enable Containers
containers.upgrade.description: Containers is included in the Workers Paid plan. To start using Containers, upgrade your Workers plan.
containers.get_started.title: Get started with Containers
containers.get_started.description: With Containers, you can build applications that seamlessly integrate Workers with a serverless container runtime.
containers.get_started.steps.title: Deploy your first Container
containers.sidebar.cli.title: Start with CLI
containers.sidebar.cli.description: Get started with CLI for Workers for Platforms
containers.sidebar.analytics.requests.to: Total request count across all Workers in a dispatch namespace.
containers.sidebar.analytics.cpu_time.to: CPU time combined across Dispatch Workers and Workers in a dispatch  namespace.
containers.sidebar.analytics.scripts.too: The number of Workers combined across all dispatch namespaces.
containers.metrics.aggregate.tooltip: Toggle between metrics for each instance and aggregate metrics across all instances
containers.metrics.aggregate.disabled.to: You can only see aggregate metrics when there are over %{limit} instances
containers.metrics.charts.diskUsage.aver: Average disk usage across %{instances} instances (includes both container and host VM disk)
containers.container.no_instances: This container has no instances. If you have just deployed the container, it may take a few minutes for the instances to be provisioned
containers.container.no_instances.ready: You have no running containers (but they are ready to go)
containers.container.no_instances.check_: You have no running containers (check back later)
containers.tutorials.title: Tutorials
containers.tutorials.description: Learn how to use Containers with step-by-step tutorials.
containers.tutorials.description_empty: Learn how to build and deploy your first Container with step-by-step tutorials.
containers.container.logs_disabled.desct: To enabled Container logs, add the snippet below to your Worker's <0>wrangler.jsonc</0> config:
Then redeploy your Worker with <0>wrangler deploy</0>.
containers.state.updating.info: A new version of this container is being rolled out.
containers.state.degraded.info: This container has launched but one or more instances have errored or failed. It may recover automatically.
containers.state.active.info: This container is up and has a live instance running.
containers.state.ready.info: This container is ready but no instances are active.
containers.state.provisioning.info: This container is currently being provisioned. It may be able to serve some traffic.
containers.rollout.info: Live instances are being updated to a new Container configuration.
containers.errors.container_exit.message: The container encountered an error at runtime and exited. Your logs might contain more information.
